intro: Pycnarrhena lucida, commonly known as the shining pycnarrhena, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a striking contrast between the petals and the velvety leaves. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
